title: WNBA Finals Game 4 live: Lynx stars are hot in close, must-win duel vs. Liberty
description: Minnesota tries to force a Game 5 in what continues to be dramatic, hard-fought series. NY is taking aim at a first WNBA title. Follow along here!
author: Yahoo Sports
excerpt: Can the Lynx force a Game 5 in what has been an outstanding back-and-forth series?
text: The New York Liberty are 40 minutes from the franchise's first WNBA championship.Standing in their way are the Minnesota Lynx, who are down 2-1 but with a home court to defend in Game 4 on Friday night at the Target Center.Can the Lynx force a Game 5 in what has been an outstanding back-and-forth series?From Yahoo Sports' Cassandra Negley's latest on the Finals:The Lynx are on the brink of elimination after playing a strong Game 3 in which they fell short in the final minutes. After leading for a mere 5.1 seconds of regulation and 3:17 overall in the first 85 minutes of the series, the Lynx built the double-digit early lead they wanted and found more offensive performances around Collier. It evaporated, though, and not enough shots fell in the final minutes. New York led for two minutes, 13 seconds in Game 3 to pull within 40 minutes of the franchise’s first championship.A true understanding of the ups and downs is often only found by experience. The Liberty, many of whom noted after winning Game 3 that the next game would be the hardest, played together in the Finals last year. They lost to the Las Vegas Aces, who lost the Finals in 2020. It’s tough to find a WNBA champion without a veteran leader who had experienced the season’s final series at least once prior to winning it.“The Finals is a win-or-go-home type of vibe, so everything is upped,” said Lynx guard Courtney Williams, who lost the five-game 2019 Finals with the Connecticut Sun. “The intensity, the sense of urgency, everything. All the small details. It’s just a whole ’nother level.”Minnesota will need to reach another level if it wants to extend the series to a winner-take-all Game 5 Sunday in New York.Live29 updatesFri, October 18, 2024 at 5:59 PM PDTHALF: Lynx 46, Liberty 45The first half we all deserve. The Lynx offense is balanced between McBride (14p, 4-5, 2-3 3s), Williams (13p, 6-10) and Collier (12p, 4-8, 2-3 3s). Liberty head coach Sandy Brondello thought the Lynx tenacious defense early in Game 3 might have tired them out. They've been solid this game, but not as frantic all over the court. That might be to their advantage in a long game they have to have.New York's big 3 are quiet. Breanna Stewart (2-11) has to come alive in the second half and avoid fouling (three). Jones is shooting 100%, but could use more touches to open things up. Ionescu is 3-9.Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:54 PM PDTCourtney Williams, whatta dog. Scores over Stewart and draws the foul for an and-1. Kayla McBride drives on the Lynx next possession and draws another quick foul on Stewart. Loudest the arena has been all night and everyone is on their feet. Minnesota leads, 47-43, in the final minute.Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:51 PM PDTStewart comes back in and scores off a cutting layup. She missed her first seven shots and is 2-10 (now 2-11 as of typing this).Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:51 PM PDTFri, October 18, 2024 at 5:50 PM PDTFri, October 18, 2024 at 5:42 PM PDTTrading buckets at a quick pace here in the second quarter. Liberty lead, 37-34, at 5:52 (Min TO).Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:42 PM PDTyeah Target Center is DEFINITELY louder tonight— Cassandra Negley (@CasNegley) October 19, 2024Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:34 PM PDTFri, October 18, 2024 at 5:32 PM PDT1Q: Lynx 23, Liberty 23It's the first time this series a team has not taken a double-digit lead into the second quarter. There's been six lead changes and fiv. Minnesota led by as many as four and New York as many as three.Kayla McBride has eight points shooting 75% overall and from 3. Napheesa Collier has eight points, three rebounds, three assists and one steal. Jonquel Jones (7p, 3r, 1a) and Betnijah Laney-Hamilton (7p, 2r) lead for New York. It could finally be a big all-around game for Jones if Smith isn't at 100% and the Lynx focus on Stewart.Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:24 PM PDTFri, October 18, 2024 at 5:20 PM PDTFri, October 18, 2024 at 5:18 PM PDTAlanna Smith looked stiff after attempting that reverse layup. She injured her back on contact with Jonquel Jones last game and Reeve said they're carrying on with her minutes as if it never happened. Smith insisted over the past day there was no way she wouldn't play in this game and the performance staff is helping her stay as loose as possible.Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:17 PM PDTFri, October 18, 2024 at 5:14 PM PDTFri, October 18, 2024 at 5:08 PM PDTThe Lynx mascot took over midcourt while the Liberty were trying to take their spots and appeared to stare off Leonie Fiebich?Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:07 PM PDTFri, October 18, 2024 at 5:07 PM PDTFri, October 18, 2024 at 5:01 PM PDTThey're expecting another 19K sell-out for the final Lynx game at Target Center this season. "Let's Go Lynx" T-shirts were draped on every seat to create another white-out and fans have black towels with Kayla McBride's likeness on them.Fri, October 18, 2024 at 4:57 PM PDTMinnesota head coach Cheryl Reeve said after Game 3 the Lynx played a good game, but didn't make enough shots. She didn't always like the shot selection from her team (38.7%)."We had good shots. Didn't make shots, right?" Reeve said. "And that's what it comes down to. You know, Stewie was making shots. JJ, their big three. ... And obviously, you know, Sab's shot at the end. We talked about that players making plays. And, you know, unfortunately, we didn't make enough of them."Fri, October 18, 2024 at 4:49 PM PDTImmediately after winning Game 3, Liberty players said winning the closeout tonight would be the most difficult. They've approached it as this is it; there is no Sunday. Breanna Stewart said yesterday that they needed to play with a sense of urgency and avoid complacency."Game 1 was like a serious wake up call for all of us, and probably the best thing to have happened to us," Stewart said. "Because it's just like be up the ones we still lose. We were up 18, and we still lost. Things were in our control, and we didn't actually take advantage or make sure that we were dictating the entire time. Knowing how incredible this Final series is, how good Minny is, and continue to respect our opponents, but know that there's another level that we want to get to."
html:
The New York Liberty are 40 minutes from the franchise's first WNBA championship.

Standing in their way are the Minnesota Lynx, who are down 2-1 but with a home court to defend in Game 4 on Friday night at the Target Center.

Can the Lynx force a Game 5 in what has been an outstanding back-and-forth series?

From Yahoo Sports' Cassandra Negley's latest on the Finals:

The Lynx are on the brink of elimination after playing a strong Game 3 in which they fell short in the final minutes. After leading for a mere 5.1 seconds of regulation and 3:17 overall in the first 85 minutes of the series, the Lynx built the double-digit early lead they wanted and found more offensive performances around Collier. It evaporated, though, and not enough shots fell in the final minutes. New York led for two minutes, 13 seconds in Game 3 to pull within 40 minutes of the franchise’s first championship.

A true understanding of the ups and downs is often only found by experience. The Liberty, many of whom noted after winning Game 3 that the next game would be the hardest, played together in the Finals last year. They lost to the Las Vegas Aces, who lost the Finals in 2020. It’s tough to find a WNBA champion without a veteran leader who had experienced the season’s final series at least once prior to winning it.

“The Finals is a win-or-go-home type of vibe, so everything is upped,” said Lynx guard Courtney Williams, who lost the five-game 2019 Finals with the Connecticut Sun. “The intensity, the sense of urgency, everything. All the small details. It’s just a whole ’nother level.”

Minnesota will need to reach another level if it wants to extend the series to a winner-take-all Game 5 Sunday in New York.

Live29 updates

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:59 PM PDT

    HALF: Lynx 46, Liberty 45

    The first half we all deserve. The Lynx offense is balanced between McBride (14p, 4-5, 2-3 3s), Williams (13p, 6-10) and Collier (12p, 4-8, 2-3 3s). Liberty head coach Sandy Brondello thought the Lynx tenacious defense early in Game 3 might have tired them out. They've been solid this game, but not as frantic all over the court. That might be to their advantage in a long game they have to have.

    New York's big 3 are quiet. Breanna Stewart (2-11) has to come alive in the second half and avoid fouling (three). Jones is shooting 100%, but could use more touches to open things up. Ionescu is 3-9.

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:54 PM PDT

    Courtney Williams, whatta dog. Scores over Stewart and draws the foul for an and-1. Kayla McBride drives on the Lynx next possession and draws another quick foul on Stewart. Loudest the arena has been all night and everyone is on their feet. Minnesota leads, 47-43, in the final minute.

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:51 PM PDT

    Stewart comes back in and scores off a cutting layup. She missed her first seven shots and is 2-10 (now 2-11 as of typing this).

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:51 PM PDT

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:50 PM PDT

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:42 PM PDT

    Trading buckets at a quick pace here in the second quarter. Liberty lead, 37-34, at 5:52 (Min TO).

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:42 PM PDT

    yeah Target Center is DEFINITELY louder tonight

    — Cassandra Negley (@CasNegley) October 19, 2024

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:34 PM PDT

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:32 PM PDT

    1Q: Lynx 23, Liberty 23

    It's the first time this series a team has not taken a double-digit lead into the second quarter. There's been six lead changes and fiv. Minnesota led by as many as four and New York as many as three.

    Kayla McBride has eight points shooting 75% overall and from 3. Napheesa Collier has eight points, three rebounds, three assists and one steal. Jonquel Jones (7p, 3r, 1a) and Betnijah Laney-Hamilton (7p, 2r) lead for New York. It could finally be a big all-around game for Jones if Smith isn't at 100% and the Lynx focus on Stewart.

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:24 PM PDT

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:20 PM PDT

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:18 PM PDT

    Alanna Smith looked stiff after attempting that reverse layup. She injured her back on contact with Jonquel Jones last game and Reeve said they're carrying on with her minutes as if it never happened. Smith insisted over the past day there was no way she wouldn't play in this game and the performance staff is helping her stay as loose as possible.

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:17 PM PDT

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:14 PM PDT

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:08 PM PDT

    The Lynx mascot took over midcourt while the Liberty were trying to take their spots and appeared to stare off Leonie Fiebich?

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:07 PM PDT

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:07 PM PDT

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 5:01 PM PDT

    They're expecting another 19K sell-out for the final Lynx game at Target Center this season. "Let's Go Lynx" T-shirts were draped on every seat to create another white-out and fans have black towels with Kayla McBride's likeness on them.

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 4:57 PM PDT

    Minnesota head coach Cheryl Reeve said after Game 3 the Lynx played a good game, but didn't make enough shots. She didn't always like the shot selection from her team (38.7%).

    "We had good shots. Didn't make shots, right?" Reeve said. "And that's what it comes down to. You know, Stewie was making shots. JJ, their big three. ... And obviously, you know, Sab's shot at the end. We talked about that players making plays. And, you know, unfortunately, we didn't make enough of them."

  • Fri, October 18, 2024 at 4:49 PM PDT

    Immediately after winning Game 3, Liberty players said winning the closeout tonight would be the most difficult. They've approached it as this is it; there is no Sunday. Breanna Stewart said yesterday that they needed to play with a sense of urgency and avoid complacency.

    "Game 1 was like a serious wake up call for all of us, and probably the best thing to have happened to us," Stewart said. "Because it's just like be up the ones we still lose. We were up 18, and we still lost. Things were in our control, and we didn't actually take advantage or make sure that we were dictating the entire time. Knowing how incredible this Final series is, how good Minny is, and continue to respect our opponents, but know that there's another level that we want to get to."
